Term.Name: Interlaced
Term.Definition: This technique uses two fields to create a frame. One field contains all the odd lines in the image, the other contains all the even lines of the image. Interlaced video is a technique of doubling the perceived frame rate.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Progressive
Term.Definition: Progressive scanning (alternatively referred to as noninterlaced scanning) is a way of displaying, storing, or transmitting moving images in which all the lines of each frame are drawn in sequence.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML
